image.altText: a skyline with houses

items.synopsis: Interest rates climb above 4 per cent for the first time in more than 11 years, as the Reserve Bank moves aggressively to clamp down on inflation.

title.children: Property analyst warns of 'panicky selling' as RBA pushes interest rates past breaking point

image.altText: A young man.

items.synopsis: Joel Russo, who was only months out of prison when he repeatedly raped a female jogger on the banks of Melbourne's Merri Creek is jailed for more than 20 years.

title.children: Serial rapist jailed for 'horrendous' attack on female jogger along Melbourne creek

image.altText: A young man in a blue t-shirt speaks while an Indonesian officer watches

items.synopsis: An Australian man accused of going on a naked, drunken rampage in Indonesia will be released from prison after more than a month in detention.

title.children: 'I made a fool of myself': Australian arrested over drunken rampage in Indonesia freed after compo deal

image.altText: A satellite image of a dam wall rupture unleashing a flood of water.

items.synopsis: A vast Soviet-era dam in the Russian controlled part of southern Ukraine was blown up on Tuesday, unleashing a flood of water across the war zone, according to both Ukrainian and Russian forces.

title.children: Hundreds of thousands ordered to evacuate after dam in Russian-controlled Ukraine blown up

image.altText: A suburban street; a white, one-storey house on the left and an unfinished two-storey house on the right

items.synopsis: The construction industry insolvency crisis is sweeping the nation, and it's devastating for both consumers and builders. So what can be done about it?

title.children: Builders go bust in record numbers, leaving thousands of Australian home owners in the lurch

image.altText: A man looks bereft during an AFL match

items.synopsis: Collingwood star Jordan de Goey has escaped with the minimum ban for his bump on Elijah Hewett with the midfielder to serve a three-match ban.

title.children: Collingwood's Jordan De Goey suspended for three matches for bump on Elijah Hewett

image.altText: A hand tapping a myki public transport card onto a turnstile

items.synopsis: A firm has revealed in a letter to Premier Daniel Andrews that its bid to take over the myki ticketing system was $100 million cheaper than the winning bid.

title.children: Andrews government defends myki contract amid fierce criticism from Opal card operator

image.altText: A man in a suit walkig out of court.

items.synopsis: A "veteran of brothels" convicted of raping, choking and spitting in the mouth of a sex worker at a Canberra brothel, has walked free from court after being sentenced in the ACT Supreme Court today.

title.children: 'Veteran of brothels' who raped and choked Canberra sex worker walks free

image.altText: a man wearing dark glasses leaving court

items.synopsis: The former teacher has pleaded not guilty to one count of carnal knowledge of a girl aged over 10 and under 17.

title.children: Witness claims Chris Dawson warned him to 'stay away' from 16-year-old student

image.altText: A man stands smiling next to a brightly coloured spinning wheel with Binance written on it.

items.synopsis: Binance founder Changpeng Zhao has been accused of operating a "web of deception". Who is the ambitious chief executive behind the company which dominates the crypto industry?

title.children: Binance founder Changpeng Zhao and his company are facing charges. How did he become the most powerful man in crypto?

image.altText: A smiling Ange Postecoglou stands on a stage holding a trophy with green and white ribbons, as another cup stands on a podium.,

items.synopsis: It's official — Ange Postecoglou leaves Celtic to make history as the first Australian to manage a Premier League team, with Spurs confirming he has signed a four-year contract.

title.children: Ange Postecoglou makes historic move to the Premier League, confirmed as new Spurs manager

image.altText: A woman holding bills outside a house

items.synopsis: Mia De Rauch says she has "no more time to give" as she runs a video production business and works hospitality shifts to keep up with increasing mortgage repayments and bills.

title.children: Rates rise smashes business owner already working two jobs

image.altText: Former FBI agent Robert Hanssen smiles for a portrait photo.

items.synopsis: A former FBI agent who took more than $2 million in cash and diamonds to trade secrets with Moscow in one of the most notorious spying cases in American history, dies in prison.

title.children: Robert Hanssen, FBI agent who spied for Russia, found dead in prison

image.altText: a woman lying on the green grass with a baby by her side

items.synopsis: Extensive scientific and medical evidence proved to be key to setting Kathleen Folbigg free, 20 years after she was convicted of killing her four children.

title.children: The one-in-35-million mutation and the science that set Kathleen Folbigg free

image.altText: Richard Marles and Ishmael Kalsakau smile as they shake hands while standing in front of the flags of Vanuatu and Australia.

items.synopsis: Vanuatu's Prime Minister Ishmael Kalsakau told Defence Minister Richard Marles the National Security Council was going over the details of the deal, which would come to parliament before the end of the year.

title.children: Vanuatu security deal with Australia to go before its parliament before the end of 2023

image.altText: A dry lake bed.

items.synopsis: Scientists say we need to make 'very rapid and very large' emissions cuts as atmospheric CO2 jumps to an all-time high at the Mauna Loa Atmospheric Baseline Observatory.

title.children: At Hawaii's Mauna Loa observatory, CO2 levels have broken a new record

image.altText: An illustration of a woman on a landline style phone wearing prison greens

items.synopsis: While some US states are making prison phone calls free, a 12-minute phone call from a Victorian prison can cost more than a prisoner's wages for the day.

title.children: Reforms needed to address expensive prison phone call costs, advocates say

image.altText: The roots of a branch photographed against the cracked, dry earth.

items.synopsis: The odds of a warm, dry winter and spring have shortened after the Bureau of Meteorology took its El Niño warning to a new level.

title.children: Bureau declares El Niño alert, signalling higher chance of warm, dry weather

image.altText: Tasmanian petrol prices falling

items.synopsis: A Tasmanian man who used a company fuel card to buy more than $24,000 worth of fuel, some of which he onsold to friends, avoids prison — the court acknowledging his marriage breakdown caused "great upheaval" for him before the offending started.

title.children: Man uses employer's fuel card to unlawfully buy more than $20k of petrol

image.altText: A front-on image of a lion, standing in the grass of a zoo enclosure, looking in the distance to the right of shot.

items.synopsis: Billabong Zoo in Port Macquarie has announced the death of Milo due to post-surgery complications after he had been diagnosed with a rare autoimmune condition.

title.children: Zoo and visitors left mourning loss of 'our beautiful lion king'

image.altText: A man sitting on a rock inside a cave.

items.synopsis: Palaeontologists say they found the oldest known burial site in the world, containing remains of a small-brained distant relative of humans previously thought incapable of complex behaviour.

title.children: World's oldest burial site found in South Africa, dating back to at least 200,000 BC

image.altText: a man wearing a suit standing in front of video and photo cameras

items.synopsis: The full findings into the Victoria Cross recipient's unsuccessful defamation lawsuit are now public, and outline Justice Anthony Besanko's reasoning. Here are five findings you may have missed.

title.children: Five key findings from the Ben Roberts-Smith judgement

image.altText: A drone shot of rows of houses in Shell Cove, Wollongong's south.

items.synopsis: Tell us your loan size, term and interest rate, and our mortgage repayment calculator will work out how much extra you may have to pay on your loan.

title.children: How much extra could mortgage repayments be, now that the cash rate is 4.1 per cent?

image.altText: Selfie of 16-year-old Pasawm Lyhym.

items.synopsis: Two boys aged 17 and 18 have been charged with various offences following a brawl in Sunshine last month during which a teenager was fatally stabbed.

title.children: Two more teenagers charged over fatal stabbing of Pasawm Lyhym at Sunshine

image.altText: Flynn wears a white shirt with black stripes and smiles in the backyard of his home

items.synopsis: For more than three decades, researchers have known that children from larger families are less likely to develop allergic disease, but the potential reason for that remained a mystery.

title.children: Why having older brothers and sisters who bug you could be good for your health

image.altText: image of woolworth building at mooroopna

items.synopsis: Police say they are reviewing charges against a 19-year-old man after a 46-year-old man died in hospital a fortnight after allegedly being assaulted in a Mooroopna supermarket.

title.children: Alleged supermarket bashing victim dies in hospital

image.altText: A woman sitting on a staircase, wearing augmented reality goggles.

items.synopsis: Apple unveils a long-rumoured headset that will place its users between the virtual and real worlds.

title.children: Apple has unveiled a new AR headset. Here's what to know about Vision Pro

image.altText: A birds eye view of a mine with a pit and a pool of water.

items.synopsis: This Bougainville community is living on a literal goldmine, but some residents say that despite it being abandoned for decades, it poses a risk to their environment and human rights.

title.children: The waters in this part of a remote jungle are so blue there are fears over what runs in them

image.altText: Convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein in his 2017 mug shot.

items.synopsis: More than 4,000 pages of documents related to the disgraced financier's death have been obtained under the Freedom of Information Act, including a detailed psychological reconstruction of the events leading to his suicide in prison.

title.children: New details about events surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death revealed in documents

image.altText: Burke speaks sitting at a desk with a sunrise backdrop behind him.

items.synopsis: Mining, construction and farming and other business groups have mounted a campaign over changes the Employment Minister Tony Burke says the government is not proposing to make.

title.children: 'Strangest debate': Burke says business launched campaign against laws government is not proposing

image.altText: A smiling mum with her smiling baby.

items.synopsis: A GP clinic in south-west Victoria has taken the extraordinary step of recruiting an in-house childcare worker so its doctors and nurses can spend more time with patients.

title.children: Surgery seeks childcare worker as staff struggle with shortage

image.altText: A woman and a man standing together outside both in white t-shirts

items.synopsis: It took 15 months for Carolyn Hocking to receive her husband's superannuation after his sudden death. She says the financial and emotional strain of the delay was "horrendous" – and she is not alone.

title.children: Widows' distress compounded by delays to late husbands' super payouts

image.altText: A man stands in front of a lectern.

items.synopsis: A court hears that Richard Hayden used money that should have gone to clients for their home deposits to pay for luxury holidays and medical bills for his dying wife. It brought an end to an almost 100-year-old family company.

title.children: Real estate agent admits stealing from clients to give dying wife a good end to life
